intro: Muhlenbergia japonica var. hakonensis, commonly known as Japanese muhlenbergia, is a clump-forming grass native to Japan. It features fine, silver-blue foliage that adds a soft texture to gardens. The plant produces delicate, feathery plumes in late summer, which are visually striking. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil. This ornamental grass is popular in landscaping for its aesthetic appeal and low maintenance requirements.
